title: Composite Materials
intent: Combine different elements to achieve properties that none of them provide alone.

triz_principle.name: Composite Materials
triz_principle.definition: Use composite structures made of different materials to obtain combined advantages.

problem_understanding.core_contradiction: We want simplicity, but single approaches cannot satisfy all competing requirements.
problem_understanding.why_this_hurts: Pure solutions force trade-offs: speed vs control, flexibility vs stability, autonomy vs governance.
typical_signals: solutions optimized for one dimension only

solution_logic.core_idea: Deliberately combine different approaches, each covering the other's weaknesses.
solution_logic.key_rule: Design the composition explicitly, not accidentally.
solution_logic.how_it_resolves_the_contradiction: The composite delivers balanced properties without forcing a single extreme.

consulting: portfolio approaches instead of single bets
enterprise_sap: SAP core with external side services
standard processes augmented by flexible tooling

use_when: requirements conflict but both are essential
do_not_use_when: simplicity alone is the dominant goal

diagnostic_questions: Where should boundaries between elements lie?

example.before: Either strict centralized governance or uncontrolled local freedom.
example.after: Central rules with controlled local extensions form a balanced composite.
